title: A TV Show About Models and Its Big Impact
summary: America's Next Top Model was a popular TV show where people competed to become models. It started in 2003 and ran for many years, shown in many countries. The show had exciting moments, like when the host Tyra Banks got very angry at a contestant. It also included challenges that could be mean or dangerous, which made people talk about whether it went too far. During the pandemic, new viewers watched it and wondered if it should have been made. The show influenced other countries to make their own versions. A winner named Sophie Sumner said the American show was tougher than the British one, with judges criticizing looks, reflecting the modeling world at that time.

background_read: America's Next Top Model was a reality TV show where aspiring models competed in challenges to win a modeling contract. It was famous for dramatic moments and sparked debates about fairness in television. The show influenced global entertainment and reflected issues in the modeling industry.
